website_summaries.verdict: Hikers compare – and prefer – this model to the Quest 4D. Heavier than others and recommended mostly for longer trips.
pros: Lightweight and supportive, with amazing grip in wet terrain
GORE-TEX membrane provides optimal waterproof, breathable protection
Waterproof nubuck leather and full grain leather upper materials
Gusseted tongue helps keep debris out
QUICKLACE™ system allows for easy, on-the-go adjustments
Smooth textile lining offers a great in-shoe feel
Advanced Chassis is comprised of the EVA midsole for active comfort and reduced fatigue, the stabilizing TPU chassis, and rubber outsole
IMolded shank supplies add support.Non-marking CONTAGRIP rubber outsole delivers uncompromising traction over mixed terrain
cons: May chafe if you don't wear them with tall socks

customer_reviews.title: Not the best hiking boots but okay
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these boots, but I must say that I do not. I have a regular pair of hiking boots that don't have the ankle protection and I love them for comfort, fit and durability. These boots, however, are a bit narrow, but what I noticed the most was how uncomfortable the footbed is. My feet were hurting after only an hour of wear. I bought two pair of shoe cushion inserts and use both pair at the same time in order to have some comfort while wearing these shoes. I think they look good, and they offer great ankle protection which I need.
customer_reviews.author: Grandmom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Hiking Boots
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a nice pair of hiking boots and these fit the bill. The are comfortable and not too heavy or light. Depending on what socks you wear and how tight you tie the boots, there may be a little chaffing after a full day of hiking. I once wore the boots with ankle socks and by the end of the day they started to chaff. Wearing them with taller socks works well.
customer_reviews.author: AngelSora

customer_reviews.title: ... boots for 15 years and I've always been extremely satisfied in the past
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying Salomon boots for 15 years and I've always been extremely satisfied in the past. On these shoes, on of the rivet broke on my first hike. It was raining and my feet were soaking wet, so the goretex didn't work as it used to be in the past 5 pairs I bought from that brand. It's extremely disappointing. I'm sending them back for a refund hoping Amazon will do the right thing given they have been worn once. Maybe I received a defective pair, but it is still very upsetting.
customer_reviews.author: Oroshi

customer_reviews.title: Tight toe box
customer_reviews.text: I think the boot would be fine for someone with narrower feet. While I don't have wide feet, I have trouble finding hiking boots with a toe box wide enough to accommodate my toe sock liners and over socks. I love Salomon products as I know they are well made and long lived. If you need a wide toe box, go with either the Quest 4d or the Quest Prime.
customer_reviews.author: Red HikerTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great for long backpacking trips on tough terrain
customer_reviews.text: They are wonderful shoes, extremely comfortable with great ankle support. However, they are rather heavy and I would only recommend for long backpacking trips that require a serious ankle support due to terrain. I ended up with Lowa Renegades for day hikes in Scotland and Ireland....they worked amazingly and didn't have the extra weight that these have.
customer_reviews.author: Looooo Loooooo

customer_reviews.title: great support/good fit
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. There was virtually no break in period necessary. they fit as expected- true to size and are very comfortable. they give me the additional ankle support that I needed after breaking an ankle so I am able to return to hiking and feel my ankle has support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit is great
customer_reviews.text: I love Salomon and these are very lightweight. fit is comfortable and I stick my extreme high arch inserts in and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These boots fit perfectly and I can wear them on ...
customer_reviews.text: These boots fit perfectly and I can wear them on a hike without having to break them in! Order your regular size, no need to order a half size up.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Best boots ever!
customer_reviews.text: My last pair of solomon hiking boots finally wore out . . . 18 years of hard use so I naturally had to get another pair of these awesome boots! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: J B

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful hiking boots!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for hiking but I used them on first snow day and they are work. My feet still warm and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Wille

customer_reviews.title: I Loved these boots from the moment they went on
customer_reviews.text: I Loved these boots from the moment they went on. Warm,comfortable, Sturdy around the ankles,and made very well. They look Sharp too!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I recommend these boots for hikers!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! Amazing support and grip, along with super comfy ortho-inserts!
customer_reviews.author: Ellie K.

customer_reviews.title: Best boots ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best hiking boots I have ever worn. Comfortable on the very first all day hike.
customer_reviews.author: Mizile

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Love how sturdy these boots are. You do need to break them in and they will hurt your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Walker

product_meta.title: Salomon Women's X Ultra Trek GTX W Backpacking Boot
product_meta.description:
The women's x ultra trek gtx® is a lightweight, speed hiking Monster with aggressive traction and complete waterproof protection. It devours trails, helping you move quickly over hard or soft surfaces.

Salomon was born in 1947 in the heart of the French Alps and the birthplace of modern alpinism. Driven by a passion for skiing and design innovation, Francois Salomon and his son George designed and perfected much of the first modern ski equipment. During the following 60 years, Salomon's commitment to innovative design and passion for mountain sports created a vast range of revolutionary new concepts in boots, skis and apparel and brought innovative solutions to footwear, apparel and equipment for hiking, adventure racing, mountaineering and trail running. Through performance-driven design, Salomon enhances mountain sports by converting new ideas into action and expanding the limits of possibility.
feature_bullets: To make one of the lightest hiking shoes ever, we used lightweight materials and welded seams. This combination reduces weight while maintaining flexibility and comfort on the trail.
Aggressive lugs with a reverse chevron pattern help the non-marking Contagrip sole claw into any surface, for confidence on every hike.
Mountains almost always give you unexpected weather. Full GORE-TEX bootie ensures comfort in the harshest weather conditions.
